Section A: Executive Summary

Facility Name: Planada Wastewater Treatment Plan #1000 - 0018-5444

Executive Summary

This facility is operated by employees of the Planada Community Services District Water District(PCSD).  The location of the facility is 8597 Toews Road.  Planada, CA in Merced County.  This summary was prepared to comply with the Risk Management Plan requirements set forth in the Clean Air Act (CAA), Section 112 (r).  The facility contains or has the potential to contain approximately 2000 or more pounds of chlorine.  The volume of chlorine on site is normally 2000 pounds.  There are two cylinders on the site.  When one is empty the regulator is switched to another and an additional tank is ordered.  

This plan includes maps of the area with corresponding maps indicated the possible hazard zone under the Worst Case Scenario and an Alternative Release Scenario as required by the CAA and CalARP for Program 3 facilities.  These maps delineate the areas that are considered to be in the hazard zones under each scenario and the area that will need to either be evacuated or have the residents or occupants sheltered in place.  Within the zone are two population groups of concern.  There is a labor camp on E. Gerard Ave. and a public school on Childs Ave.  

The Planada Community Services District has taken numerous precautions to prevent releases of chlorine gases that could affect their employee, nearby residences or the public.  The precautions include on site alarm systems to warn employees of leaks of chlorine.  An automatic communication system that notified operators of the leak.  The operators will then relay the information to County HazMat Emergency responders.  The chlorine is stored in appropriate containers within a cement block building that has a ventilations system that can be controlled from outside the building.
